column4: luigi: hmm, no I have a core 2 processor and ubuntu uses both.. fully when I complie a kernel =)
could you see it before installing vmtools
do a df -h again and pastebin it for me =)
ok so run fdisk -l and pastebin that
I'm not used to ubuntu's fstab setup. I have never used UUID's for mounting filesytems.. =)
ok try this... do a mkdir /t and then run `mount /dev/cciss/c0d0p1 /t
pastebin fdisk -l to a new pastbin window
not sure... its listed in your /etc/fstab
much better... now try mounting /dev/sda1 to /t
ah ok.. to ubuntu is now switching to UUID: mount points like mdadm =(
so you could replace your entries in /etc/fstab.. /dev/sda1 for root, /dev/sda5 swap and I would think /dev/sda2 for boot?
